stgdContent.tagContent: (Music. Animal Academy. The playground has a play tunnel, a bench, a cornhole game, and hopscotch. BROOKS enters, with a decorated gift bag under their arm, and scurries around. BROOKS charges through the tunnel, tosses bean bags as if playing the game with abandon, jumps and rolls up on the bench. Hopscotches a bit. Lets out a big, big sigh. ED enters, carrying a decorated gift bag. BROOKS tries to get ED's attention, but ED is listening to music in their earbuds)
(ED comes to rest inside the tunnel. ED is grooving with the tunes. BROOKS is getting frustrated)

characterAction.tagContent: Okay, Ed. I got no choice.

stgdContent.tagContent: (BROOKS tosses a piece of candy from their bag, which hits ED)

characterAction.tagContent: I didn't hear you! See? Earbuds?
I needed you to answer me.
What's the emergency? You gave up a red Starburst!
Uh—yeah. Can I have it back?

stgdContent.tagContent: (ED picks it up and puts it in his bag)

characterAction.tagContent: I don't think so. Throwing stuff at people is not good manners.
Well, not answering people when they talk to you is bad manners, too!
I told you. Earbuds. I did not hear.
So? Give me back my candy.
Hey! You owe me an apology.
I don't owe you, you tossed it.
You let go. You're breaking it!
You're breaking your own bag! Let go!

stgdContent.tagContent: (TORY enters during the kerfuffle. TORY has a red backpack, and wears heart-infused clothes. TORY is singing loudly, something like “You've Got a Friend in Me.” TORY has a red gift bag decorated with their name. TORY sits on the bench. BROOKS and ED stop fighting for a moment and turn to look)

characterAction.tagContent: Whoa. I can't believe we have a fox in our class…
You're overreacting. You don't even know her yet. You acted just like this when we got a bear classmate. And when there was an eagle… and—
Technically, she's a red fox. Red foxes are known for their intelligence, and their loyalty to their families, and—
Not. In. The mood. For. Another. Ed-speech. What if it was an alligator, or a shark? They love yummy turtles! Yeah. Bet you're scared now.
Oh! You're scared? Of a fox…?

stgdContent.tagContent: (BROOKS grabs ED's bag, spilling the contents. There are only two Friendship Day cards)

characterAction.tagContent: You ate all your candy already?
You only got two Friendship treats?

stgdContent.tagContent: (ED backs into the tunnel, pulling their head into their shell. TORY opens their backpack and takes out some small red baby bell cheeses)

characterAction.tagContent: I got one from the teacher, and one from a mystery student.
That was me. My dad heard that everyone had to give Friendship treats to everyone else, so he made me. You're welcome.
Okay, cheeses, are you ready for a little excitement?
Hey, that fox eats cheese, not… Um—you know—smaller animals…
If I was a hedgehog, I would be scared.
Well, maybe you're scared of everything. I'm not.
Hey. Never saw a fox eat cheese.
So, you play with your food?
Many predators have a habit of wrestling with their food—um, prey—and they–
I'm not really playing with my after-school snack. I'm juggling.
Juggling is not playing. It's art.
I brought the red cheeses because it's Friendship Day. My favorite holiday.

stgdContent.tagContent: (BROOKS hops onto the bench and walks on it like a balance beam, does a handstand, etc)

characterAction.tagContent: Um… Do you have a favorite holiday?
I just want to wait for my dad.
My favorite holiday would be National Turtle Day.
So weird. That's not a holiday.

stgdContent.tagContent: (BROOKS remains engaged with the playground equipment, scurrying and playing. Occasionally they sigh or groan)

characterAction.tagContent: Yep. May 23rd. Me and my mom go to the Shellebration of turtles everywhere. It's a spotlight on turtles! It's a focus on the need to protect turtles, tortoises, and habitats, ‘cause we're losing our places to live– Did you know that all tortoises are turtles, but not all turtles are tortoises?

This year's theme for World Turtle Day is “I Love Turtles.” A lot of kids don't know real turtles or tortoises. They only know Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles. And that's okay because it's at least a start. I mean, they were just regular baby turtles, and somebody dropped them into a sewer, and—

—then they landed in some bad goo that changed them into Big Mutants, and they have four different personalities; Leonardo “Leo”– The Leader. Donatello “Donnie”– The Genius. Michelangelo “Mikey”– The Funny One. Raphael “Raph”– The Rebel. And Mikey is the youngest one, he's really funny and—
I did not know that tortoises could talk so fast.
Oh, we're not slow all the time. Anyways, the Ninja Turtles are what my mom calls “gateway turtles…” Like the gate to caring about real ones, like me.
Wow, there's so much to know about real tortoises… and of course the, um– imaginary? Ones?
Oh. Ninja Turtles are very real.
Too late. Hey, tortoise. Ask me a question.
I asked you a question. Now it's your turn to ask me a question. That's how friends talk.
We're not. But we could be. All three of us.
Ha! I've got all the friends I need.
Then you know that friendly people SOAR.
My mom taught me this: S– Smile. O– Offer your hand. A– Ask their name. R– Repeat their name and tell them yours. S-O-A-R. SOAR. It's how to be friendly! Want to practice?

stgdContent.tagContent: (BROOKS starts playing hopscotch or bean bags)

characterAction.tagContent: Okay, then. SOAR. That's SOAR like—
Sore like I fell down and hurt my knee, boo-hoo!
That's SOAR, like flying high, like being really successful at being friendly!
Gross. And not as funny as mine.
Alright. My turn, then your turn.
S– Smile. O– Offer your hand.
A– Ask their name. What's your name?
R– Repeat their name and tell them yours. Hi Ed, I'm Tory. Yay! Now your turn, Ed.
S– Smile. O– Offer your hand.
A– Ask their name. What's your name?
R– Repeat their name and tell them yours. Hi Tory, I'm Ed.
Yes! Thanks Ed! Way to be friendly.
I can practice that at World Turtle Day.
And then, friendly folks ask questions and give compliments. Here's one:
Hey there, I like your spikes.
Oh, sorry, I thought you said thank you when I gave you a compliment. You know, manners and stuff.
Yeah. I know manners “and stuff.” But I don't have spikes.
Oh! Spines! Well, they are very nice.
But, if you have manners, you say thanks.
They look sharp, so bigger creatures won't try to– nothin.

stgdContent.tagContent: (BROOKS sits, then curls up. ED puts his earbuds in and backs into the tunnel)

characterAction.tagContent: This. Is. Hedgehog. For lea'me alone.

stgdContent.tagContent: (TORY looks over at ED, who is listening to music and chewing a piece of lettuce. TORY begins to hopscotch, alone, and not very well. After a beat, BROOKS approaches TORY)

characterAction.tagContent: That's ridiculous. What're you trying to do?
Thank you for asking. I am practicing hopscotch.
You're just jumping on the squares without using a marker.
That's true. But I don't know how to play with a marker.
You don't know how to play with a marker?
You're not really afraid of me, right? I don't bite. Show me? Please?
It's easy. I could show you in like, two seconds.
Well, there's lots of seconds before my mom gets here, so you can teach me thousands of times!
Whatever. But I'm serious. Two seconds! Then you have to leave me alone. Or else, I'll—

stgdContent.tagContent: (BROOKS is spooked by the tail flick. They hand TORY the marker at arm's length)
(TORY takes the marker and approaches ED)
(ED looks up. BROOKS steps in front of TORY, making a face and covertly shaking their head. ED sees)

characterAction.tagContent: I don't want Ed to play. Okay, scoot back. Toss the marker down, then watch how I jump.
Only if we all three play.
Look. You're new here. Ed doesn't care. Ed is used to being alone.
He obviously likes it that way.

stgdContent.tagContent: (TORY taps the tunnel next to where ED is sitting. ED looks up and takes out one earbud)

characterAction.tagContent: Sorry to disturb you, Ed, but I was just wondering why you sit alone.
I don't want to talk about it.
You don't have to tell me right now, but I'll be hanging out right here if you want to talk.

stgdContent.tagContent: (TORY folds their arms and leans against the tunnel. BROOKS is attempting to continue the hopscotch lesson, tossing the marker, hopping, etc. TORY sings to themselves)

characterAction.tagContent: I'm sorry, I didn't hear that, I was singing.
Well, I'm somebody, and I don't hate you. I barely even know you.
Wait a minute. You said everyone hates you. Then you said that nobody knows you.
If nobody knows you, then nobody hates you.
I don't think you can hate what you don't know!
After I toss the marker on a square, I jump over it.
C'mon Ed. It's time for JOY! J– Just jump in. O– Own your place. Y– Yes, I can.
Do you know a lot of these things? Like SOAR, like JOY?
Oh, the letter games? They're kind of a code. My mom teaches me. She's an animal whisperer. She uses them to help young animals with friendships. So, it's time to SOAR with JOY.
I jump over it. I never touch that square again. See?
I think you know. It's rude, it's bad manners, to leave someone out. And, I'm trying to use empathy.
It's putting yourself in someone else's shoes. Imagining what they must be feeling. Feeling how that feels.
Kinda. And being alone doesn't make Ed happy. So, Ed is gonna have to J-O-Y. JOY. J– Just jump in. O– Own my place. Y– Yes, I can.
Fine, but you know tortoises can't jump.
That big old shell can't get off the ground.
Ed! Come on over. Let's learn hopscotch.
Well, anyways. I toss the marker on a square, and I jump over it. I never touch the square again. See?

stgdContent.tagContent: (TORY and ED support the demonstration with oohs, ahhs, and applause. BROOKS eats it up)

characterAction.tagContent: Uh… Thank you? TORY: You're welcome. Way to go!
Sure? Cause I'm not helping you if you fall. You're on your own.

stgdContent.tagContent: (ED pulls out a bandana like the TMNT wear, and puts it on)

characterAction.tagContent: My ninja turtle head gear. Got it at the Shellebration last year.
Just toss the marker and hop!

Hey, didja know that the original hopscotch courts were over 100 feet long? Good thing they're shorter now. And the record hopscotch jumper finished the game in one minute and two seconds. And the rules change a lot, so—
Hey. Keeping our hands to ourselves is friendly. That was not.
(ending the argument by taking a big leap)

stgdContent.tagContent: (ED is an excellent hopper, exceeding the distance covered by BROOKS. TORY supports his hop with oohs, ahhs, and applause. BROOKS eventually joins in)

characterAction.tagContent: Do you ever wonder about the hop on one foot rule?
I thought you didn't know how to play.
I don't. I just know how to hop.
And, I know how to apologize.
Okay, okay. Ed, I'm sorry I shoved you.

stgdContent.tagContent: (TORY jumps with mixed success. BROOKS and ED cheer them on)
(BROOKS and ED split. BROOKS curls up on the bench. ED sits in the tunnel)
(TORY takes a moment to assess, then approaches the curled-up BROOKS)

characterAction.tagContent: I think somebody needs to practice being friendly. So, let's SOAR.
See this? I told you. This is hedgehog for lea'me alone. So, lea'me alone. I don't need friendly practice. I got friends.
You got, like, a million Friendship Day treats.
And if you tell people to do something, they do it.
I don't tell people what to do!
You always tell people not to let me play.
And they do it. That's popular.
And they always laugh at your jokes. That's popular.
Why are you so mad? I would love it if everyone liked me.
Okay. I'll prove it. Remember when I shared in morning circle today?
I told about my dog having puppies? Do you remember what kind of dog I have?
Well, knowing the kind of dog does kinda help us imagine better.
I know that. I forgot it.
You forgot what kind of dog you have?
I was standing in front of the class and I totally forgot it.
Ah. Nerves made your memory stop for a second. My mom says that can—
Anyway, I couldn't remember it. I said, “My dog is a–” and then I started stuttering. And these two girls in the back of the class kept laughing at me.
And I got really hot. I could feel my face going red. I really wanted to curl right up. I sat back down and I felt… I don't know.
Right. And nobody said anything to me. We went out to recess, and all my friends stayed away from me. They knew I was upset and they just ignored me.
It was terrible. They're supposed to be my friends. If I'm so popular, how come nobody would talk to me?
What would you want them to say?
I don't know. Like, “Are you okay?” or something.
A little empathy for you would have been good.
And, I think it's poor manners to laugh at somebody who is having a hard time.
Yeah. I guess. I feel better now.
You just wanted someone to ask.
Okay, now you gotta SOAR with me.
It doesn't hurt. If I can do it, you can do it.
I think you should do JOY first.
J– Just jump in. O– Own your space. Y– Yes, I can.
J– Just jump in. O– Own your space. Y– Yes, I can.
Okay, all together! J– Just jump in. O– Own your space. Y– Yes, I can. One more time! All together now! J– Just jump in. O– Own your space. Y– Yes, I can.
Wait, your mom taught you that?
Yeah. She helps kids be friendly and get better at making friends. Like us.
Well, I did tell you that I don't have any trouble making friends.

stgdContent.tagContent: (TORY and ED give BROOKS a look)

characterAction.tagContent: It can never hurt to be friendlier.
Okay. I have another game. Are you ready?

Questions. People who are good at making friends are good at asking questions. So, here's a beanbag from that game. We hold the beanbag, we ask a question, then we quickly toss the bag to someone else. And they ask a question and toss quickly to someone else. The game is called Speedy Q.
It's question practice. Not answer practice.
Just a question. After you ask it, you toss the bag to the person who must ask the next question.
Um. Why is the sky blue?
Why did the chicken cross the road?
What kind of dog is Clifford the Big Red Dog?
How many licks does it take to get to the center of a Tootsie Roll Pop?
What do you like to do with your family?
Why do you like the Mutant Ninja Turtles so much?
Whoa. That was hard. Taking turns, thinking fast–
Okay, if you can remember a question you really wanted to answer, go.

stgdContent.tagContent: (ED and BROOKS talk over each other, eagerly sharing the answers they held in. They overlap, but hear each other's answers. TORY watches from off to the side)

characterAction.tagContent: I do like dogs. I have a big one. Her name is Gina. And, I do have siblings, a sister and a baby brother, and my family likes to go fishing together and sometimes we play games and–

I like cats, we have two of them. They are both orange. Tater tots are better because they hold more ketchup, and I like Mikey because they are the youngest and the Ninja Turtles make me proud to be a tortoise.
So, you didn't answer yet. Why Friendship Day?
Well, I'm a red fox, and I like all the red stuff, and the hearts, and—uh—it's my birthday.
See, we do learn about each other by asking questions.
Are you having a party? Are you having cake?
Oh, you should have a party!
Sure. I'll invite all my friends. See?

stgdContent.tagContent: (TORY takes three Friendship treats out of their bag)

characterAction.tagContent: And, you're new. They weren't ready for you.
Way to practice empathy. Happy birthday, anyway.
Well, thanks. So there's a treat from the teacher. And—
—asked me to give one to everyone.
Be sure to thank your parents.
So, you're having a birthday party? Tonight?
Alright! I'll just go home and get cleaned up.
Me too. I know my mom will bring me.
Nope. No buts. We're your friends now, right?
Yes, but, we didn't do the friendly meeting thing. I don't actually remember your name.
I'll start. SOAR. S– Smile. O– Offer your hand. A– Ask their name. R– Repeat their name and tell them yours. S-O-A-R. SOAR.
S– Smile. O– Offer your hand. A– Ask. What's your name?
R– Repeat their name and tell them yours. Hi, Brooks, I'm Tory.
S– Smile. O– Offer your hand. A– Ask. What's your name?
R– Repeat their name and tell them yours. Hi Ed, I'm Brooks.
Nice to meet you! S-O-A-R SOAR!
Nice to meet you! S-O-A-R SOAR!
Nice to meet you! S-O-A-R SOAR!
Well, we'd better hustle. We have a birthday party to get to!
My mom's gonna flip that I made new friends.
I think we all got new friends.
I know, right? We. Are. Soaring.
Hey, did you know how birthday celebrations got started? Back in ancient times, 5,000 years ago, Egyptians celebrated for the—
(Music up as they exit together, laughing. Adlib)
